slides.title: Welcome to Professional Ethics
slides.content:
# Professional Ethics

Professional ethics guide **conduct and behavior** of CMAs.

## What You Will Learn

- **ICMAI Code** - Ethical framework
- **Principles** - Core values
- **Independence** - Objectivity
- **Conduct** - Professional behavior

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Ethics | Framework |
| Principles | Values |
| Independence | Objectivity |
| Conduct | Behavior |

slides.title: ICMAI Code of Ethics
slides.content:
# Professional Code

## Fundamental Principles

| Principle | Meaning |
|-----------|--------|
| Integrity | Honesty |
| Objectivity | Unbiased |
| Competence | Skills |
| Confidentiality | Secrecy |
| Professional behavior | Conduct |

## Applicability

- Members in practice
- Members in employment
- Students

## Enforcement

- Disciplinary committee
- Penalties
- Suspension/removal

slides.title: Integrity
slides.content:
# Integrity Principle

## Requirements

| Duty | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Truthfulness | Honest dealing |
| Fair dealing | No deception |
| Avoid association | With misleading info |

## Violations

- False statements
- Material omissions
- Misleading information

## Application

```
Do not:
- Sign false reports
- Withhold relevant facts
- Make misleading claims
```

slides.title: Principles Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How many fundamental principles in ICMAI code?

slides.title: Objectivity
slides.content:
# Objectivity Principle

## Requirements

| Duty | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Unbiased | No prejudice |
| Fair judgment | Professional |
| No conflicts | Avoid or disclose |

## Threats to Objectivity

| Threat | Example |
|--------|--------|
| Self-interest | Financial gain |
| Self-review | Own work |
| Advocacy | Client position |
| Familiarity | Close relationship |
| Intimidation | Threats |

## Safeguards

- Disclosure
- Withdrawal
- Second opinion

slides.title: Professional Competence
slides.content:
# Competence and Due Care

## Requirements

| Duty | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Attain | Required skills |
| Maintain | Continuous learning |
| Act diligently | Due care |
| Inform limitations | Client awareness |

## CPE

```
Continuing Professional Education

- Structured learning
- Unstructured learning
- Annual requirements
```

## Due Care

- Thorough work
- Appropriate supervision
- Documentation

slides.title: Confidentiality
slides.content:
# Confidentiality Principle

## Requirements

| Duty | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Protect | Client information |
| No disclosure | Without authority |
| No personal use | Information obtained |

## Exceptions

| Circumstance | Disclosure Allowed |
|--------------|-------------------|
| Legal | Required by law |
| Professional | Duty to disclose |
| Authorized | Client consent |

## Post-Engagement

```
Confidentiality continues
even after relationship ends
```

slides.title: Professional Behavior
slides.content:
# Conduct Standards

## Requirements

| Duty | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Comply | Laws and regulations |
| Avoid | Discrediting actions |
| Respect | Professional standards |

## Advertising

| Allowed | Not Allowed |
|---------|-------------|
| Factual | Exaggerated claims |
| Dignified | Comparative |
| Informative | Misleading |

## Professional Relationships

- Colleagues
- Other professionals
- Clients

slides.title: Independence
slides.content:
# Independence Requirements

## Two Aspects

| Type | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Of mind | Actual |
| In appearance | Perceived |

## Threats to Independence

| Factor | Risk |
|--------|------|
| Financial interest | Self-interest |
| Business relationship | Bias |
| Family relationship | Familiarity |
| Previous employment | Self-review |

## Safeguards

- Disclosure
- Rotation
- Quality review
- Withdrawal

slides.title: Conflicts of Interest
slides.content:
# Managing Conflicts

## Identification

| Type | Situation |
|------|----------|
| Client vs client | Competing interests |
| Personal vs client | Own interest |
| Role-based | Multiple roles |

## Resolution

```
1. Identify conflict
2. Evaluate significance
3. Apply safeguards
4. Decline if cannot resolve
```

## Disclosure

- Nature of conflict
- Steps taken
- Consent obtained

slides.title: Professional Misconduct
slides.content:
# Disciplinary Matters

## Types of Misconduct

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Professional | Negligence |
| Financial | Misappropriation |
| Ethical | Breach of code |

## Process

```
Complaint
    |
    v
Investigation
    |
    v
Disciplinary Committee
    |
    v
Decision
    |
    v
Appeal (if any)
```

## Penalties

- Warning
- Fine
- Suspension
- Removal from membership

slides.title: Ethical Decision Making
slides.content:
# Decision Framework

## Steps

```
1. Identify ethical issue
2. Gather facts
3. Identify alternatives
4. Evaluate consequences
5. Make decision
6. Take action
7. Review outcome
```

## Considerations

| Factor | Question |
|--------|----------|
| Legal | Is it lawful? |
| Ethical | Is it right? |
| Stakeholders | Who is affected? |
| Reputation | How does it look? |

slides.title: Corporate Governance Role
slides.content:
# CMAs in Governance

## Responsibilities

| Area | Contribution |
|------|-------------|
| Financial reporting | Accuracy |
| Internal controls | Effectiveness |
| Risk management | Oversight |

## Ethical Leadership

- Role model
- Speak up
- Support whistleblowers

## Sustainability

- ESG reporting
- Long-term value
- Stakeholder focus
